subhead: Political instability has come at a high cost, fueling growing distrust and a sense that democracy is dysfunctional, according to the 13th annual 'French Fractures' survey by Ipsos for Le Monde, the Jean Jaurès Foundation, CEVIPOF and the Montaigne Institute.

title: Putin's tortuous flight plan to Budapest
subhead: If the meeting between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin does take place in Hungary, the Russian president's plane may have to make a lengthy detour to the south to avoid flying over European Union countries that are hostile to him.

subhead: Empress Eugénie's 2,000-diamond tiara and the necklace from the sapphire set of Queen Marie-Amélie and Queen Hortense, made up of eight sapphires and 631 diamonds, were among the items stolen by a gang of four thieves who entered through a window.
byline: Laurent Telo,  Roxana Azimi and  Sylvie Kerviel

title: 'Nicolas Sarkozy's supporters have undermined the foundations of political and judicial life'
subhead: Philippe Conte, professor emeritus of criminal law at Panthéon-Assas University, says the judges who convicted the former French president of criminal conspiracy merely enforced the laws written by those now denouncing them.

title: Zaho de Sagazan: 'Without others, without friendship, you can't achieve much'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The singer-songwriter highlights the people who have shaped her journey and continue to support her.
